meanings.definition: The outer layer of cytoplasm in some protozoans.
meanings.sent1: The ectosarc protects the protozoan cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the ectosarc to understand protozoan biology.
meanings.sent3: The ectosarc of the tiny protozoan was like a shield in a microscopic battle.
meanings.sent4: Her transparent ectosarc was a barrier against the outside world.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the ectosarc shimmered like a delicate veil.

meanings.definition: The outer layer of a cell.
meanings.sent1: The ectosarc provides structure to the cell.
meanings.sent2: The biologist observed the ectosarc under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The cell's ectosarc was like the walls of a tiny fortress.
meanings.sent4: In the cell, the ectosarc acted as a protective barrier.
meanings.sent5: The ectosarc of the cell was as thin as a soap bubble.
